title: Trump’s Demand to Trading Partners: Pledge Money or Get Higher Tariffs
summary: President Trump is using an “Art of the Deal” approach to get other nations to hand over cash to lower their tariffs.

title: A.I. Has Ushered in Silicon Valley’s ‘Hard Tech’ Era
summary: Goodbye to the age of consumer websites and mobile apps. Artificial intelligence has ushered in an era of what insiders in the nation’s innovation capital call “hard tech.”

title: Nancy Mace Announces Run for Governor of South Carolina
summary: The Charleston-area congresswoman was once a moderate Republican, but has more recently presented herself as a loyal supporter of President Trump.

title: Netanyahu Squanders His Moment to Halt the War in Gaza
summary: Israel’s leader is now pushing for an “all or nothing” deal with Hamas. He has not made the compromises needed to make it happen.

title: Capitalists Love This Podcast. So Do Their Critics.
summary: “Odd Lots” goes deep on lentils in Saskatchewan, the global tractor supply and trucking markets. Is it the skeleton key to understanding this strange economic moment?

title: What Is Cardiac Amyloidosis?
summary: A quiet revolution in care is helping patients with cardiac amyloidosis, a form of heart failure that long stumped doctors.

title: Avoiding Ultraprocessed Foods Might Double Weight Loss
summary: In a new trial, people consumed more calories and had more cravings when they ate ultraprocessed foods.

title: Minimum Wage in L.A. Could Rise to $30 an Hour for Olympics
summary: A union-backed effort would boost wages for hotel and airport workers. But with tourism down, and the city in a slump, hotel owners fear for their survival.

title: Trump’s Immigrant Crackdown in New York: More Arrests, Longer Detention
summary: More than half of the immigrants arrested in the New York City area since Jan. 20 do not have criminal convictions or charges, new data shows.

title: Anatomy of an ICE Arrest
summary: Migrants show up for hearings or scheduled check-ins. In growing numbers, they end up in handcuffs as President Trump’s immigration crackdown shifts tactics.

title: Loni Anderson, Star of ‘WKRP in Cincinnati,’ Dies at 79
summary: She won Emmy nominations for her sitcom role as a deceptively smart radio station receptionist. Her divorce from Burt Reynolds landed her in the tabloids.

title: Community Colleges Have Been Hit by Trump’s War on Elite Universities
summary: Measures intended to punish elite universities are inflicting collateral damage on the nation’s two-year colleges, which educate 40 percent of all undergraduates.

title: You Are Contaminated
summary: The toxic byproducts of human civilization are everywhere. Even in our bodies.

title: Trump’s Gilded Age White House Ballroom Classicism
summary: While the president is right to try to reclaim meaning in American architecture, Gilded Age neoclassicism is not the answer.

title: System Upgrade
summary: We explore the new vibe in Silicon Valley.

title: Tesla Grants Musk $29 Billion in Stock to Keep ‘Elon’s Energies Focused’
summary: The “interim” package announced on Monday was intended to help retain Elon Musk, whose previous pay plan was invalidated by a judge.

title: Canada Wildfires Cause Poor Air Quality for Toronto, Minneapolis and New York
summary: Wildfires burning in Canada were causing unhealthy air quality across parts of North America on Monday.

title: Many Jewish Voters Back Mamdani. And Many Agree With Him on Gaza.
summary: Zohran Mamdani won over Jewish voters in New York City who were energized by his economic agenda and unbothered by — or sympathetic to — his views on Israel and Gaza.

title: El Salvador’s Leader Is Autocrat to Some, Godsend to Others
summary: Lawmakers approved constitutional changes abolishing term limits and allowing President Nayib Bukele to stay in power indefinitely. Why now?
